title: MongoDB Error Handling
subject: MongoDB
theory: Handling errors robustly is key. Common errors include Code 11000 (Duplicate Key). Network errors require retry logic.

examples.explanation: Transient network glitches should not crash the app.

interview_questions.question: What is Error Code 11000?
interview_questions.answer: Duplicate Key Error. Attempting to insert a duplicate value into a unique index field.

exam_notes: WriteConcern errors mean data might not constitute a consensus.
summary: Anticipating failure modes leads to resilient applications.
